required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial of Linaclotide in Patients With Chronic Idiopathic Constipation
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Trial of Linaclotide (72 ug or 145 ug) Administered Orally for 12 Weeks to Patients With Chronic Idiopathic Constipation

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this trial was to determine the efficacy and safety of linaclotide 72 ug administered once daily to patients with chronic idiopathic constipation (CIC). The primary efficacy parameter is the percentage of participants in each dosing group that meet the protocol definition for complete spontaneous bowel movement (CSBM) Overall Responder.

detailed_description.textblock: The trial also included a 145 ug linaclotide treatment arm (an FDA-approved dose for CIC) as an established positive control to validate the study design.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥ 4 IVRS calls for the specified week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a bowel movement BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12-Week CSBM Frequency Rate
secondary_outcome.description: A participant's 12-week CSBM Frequency Rate is the CSBM rate (CSBMs/week) calculated over the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12-Week SBM Frequency Rate
secondary_outcome.description: A participant's 12-week SBM Frequency Rate is the SBM rate (SBMs/week) calculated over the 12-weeks of the Treatment Period. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Stool Consistency Score
secondary_outcome.description: Stool consistency was measured daily using the 7-point ordinal Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS; 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts [difficult to pass]; 2 = sausage shaped but lumpy; 3 = like a sausage but with cracks on surface; 4 = like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft; 5 = soft blobs with clear-cut edges [passed easily]; 6 = fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool; 7 = watery, no solid pieces [entirely liquid]). The participant's BSFS score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing BSFS scores from the SBMs reported by the participant during the 12-week Treatment Period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Straining Score
secondary_outcome.description: Straining was measured daily using a 5-point ordinal scale (1 = not at all; 2 = a little bit; 3 = a moderate amount; 4 = a great deal; 5 = an extreme amount). The participant's straining score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing straining scores from the SBMs reported by the participant during the 12-week Treatment Period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of 12-Week CSBM Overall Responders (>1 SBM/Week Subpopulation)
secondary_outcome.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥4 IVRS calls for the specified week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

A Month 1 CSBM Responder is a participant who is a CSBM weekly responder for at least 3 of the 4 weeks of Month 1 of the Treatment Period. A CSBM weekly responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline based on a minimum of 4 complete IVRS calls for that week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

A Month 2 CSBM Responder is a participant who is a CSBM weekly responder for at least 3 of the 4 weeks of Month 2 of the Treatment Period. A CSBM weekly responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline based on a minimum of 4 complete IVRS calls for that week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

A Month 3 CSBM Responder is a participant who is a CSBM weekly responder for at least 3 of the 4 weeks of Month 3 of the Treatment Period. A CSBM weekly responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline based on a minimum of 4 complete IVRS calls for that week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Abdominal Bloating
secondary_outcome.description: Abdominal bloating was measured daily using an 11-point NRS (0 = none; 10 = very severe). The participant's abdominal bloating score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing daily participant assessments of abdominal bloating scores reported during the 12-week Treatment Period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Abdominal Discomfort
secondary_outcome.description: Abdominal discomfort was measured daily using an 11-point NRS (0 = none; 10 = very severe). The participant's abdominal discomfort score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing daily participant assessments of abdominal discomfort scores reported during the 12-week Treatment Period.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of 12-Week CSBM Overall Sustained Responders
other_outcome.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Sustained Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period, including ≥ 3 of the last 4 weeks. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥ 4 IVRS calls for the specified week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.

arm_group.description: 72 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks
145 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks
matching placebo, once daily for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has completed a colonoscopy if one is needed according to the American Gastroenterological Association (AGA) criteria, with no clinically significant findings
- Patient has no clinically significant findings on a physical examination and clinical laboratory tests
- Patient meets protocol criteria for CIC: reports < 3 bowel movements (BMs) per week and reports one or more of the following during ≥ 25% of BMs: straining, lumpy or hard stools, sensation of incomplete evacuation during the 3 months before the diagnosis with the onset at least 6 months before the diagnosis
- Patient is compliant with daily interactive voice response system (IVRS) calls
- Patient reports an average of < 3 complete spontaneous BMs (CSBMs) and ≤ 6 SBMs per week by the IVRS over the 14 calendar days before the Randomization Visit and the calendar day of Randomization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has history of loose or watery stools
- Patient has symptoms of or been diagnosed with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
- Patient has a structural abnormality of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract or a disease or condition that can affect GI motility
- Patient has any protocol-excluded or clinically significant medical or surgical history that could confound the study assessments
- Patient has Bristol Stool Form Scale score of 7 during Pretreatment period.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 2244 participants were screened; 1223 were randomized and 1021 were not randomized (478 participants were screen failures and 543 participants were pretreatment failures).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: 72 μg Linaclotide
group.description: 72 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: 145 μg Linaclotide
group.description: 145 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: 72 μg Linaclotide
group.description: 72 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: 145 μg Linaclotide
group.description: 145 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Complete Spontaneous Bowel Movement Weekly Rate
measure.description: Number of complete spontaneous bowel movements (CSBMs) per week. A CSBM is defined as a spontaneous bowel movement (SBM) that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a bowel movement (BM) that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM. Baseline efficacy values are derived from the interactive voice response system (IVRS) daily diary data collected in the Pretreatment Period, specifically the period of time from 14 days before randomization up to the time of randomization.

measure.title: Spontaneous Bowel Movement Weekly Rate
measure.description: Number of spontaneous bowel movements (SBMs) per week. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM. Baseline efficacy values are derived from the IVRS daily diary data collected in the Pretreatment Period, specifically the period of time from 14 days before randomization up to the time of randomization.

measure.title: Stool Consistency Score
measure.description: Measured daily using the 7-point ordinal Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS; 1=separate hard lumps like nuts [difficult to pass]; 2=sausage shaped but lumpy; 3=like a sausage but with cracks on surface; 4=like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft; 5=soft blobs with clear-cut edges [passed easily]; 6=fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool; 7=watery, no solid pieces [entirely liquid]). Baseline efficacy values are derived from the IVRS daily diary data collected in the Pretreatment Period, specifically the period of time from 14 days before randomization up to the time of randomization.
measure.population: Participants who did not have an SBM at baseline had missing Stool Consistency baseline scores.

measure.title: Straining Score
measure.description: Straining was measured daily using a 5-point ordinal scale (1 = not at all; 2 = a little bit; 3 = a moderate amount; 4 = a great deal; 5 = an extreme amount). Baseline efficacy values are derived from the IVRS daily diary data collected in the Pretreatment Period, specifically the period of time from 14 days before randomization up to the time of randomization.
measure.population: Participants who did not have an SBM at baseline had missing Straining baseline scores.

measure.title: Abdominal Discomfort
measure.description: Abdominal discomfort was measured daily using an 11-point numerical rating scale (NRS; 0 = none; 10 = very severe). Baseline efficacy values are derived from the IVRS daily diary data collected in the Pretreatment Period, specifically the period of time from 14 days before randomization up to the time of randomization.

measure.title: Abdominal Bloating
measure.description: Abdominal bloating was measured daily using an 11-point NRS (0 = none; 10 = very severe). Baseline efficacy values are derived from the IVRS daily diary data collected in the Pretreatment Period, specifically the period of time from 14 days before randomization up to the time of randomization.

outcome.title: Percentage of 12-Week CSBM Overall Responders
outcome.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥ 4 IVRS calls for the specified week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a bowel movement BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a primary endpoint; per protocol, data for the 145 μg dose arm were not collected for any pre-specified primary or secondary outcome measures.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: 72 μg Linaclotide
group.description: 72 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: Percentage of 12-Week CSBM Overall Responders
measure.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥ 4 IVRS calls for the specified week. measure.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a primary endpoint; per protocol, data for the 145 μg dose arm were not collected for any pre-specified primary or secondary outcome measures.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is obtained from the Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) tests controlling for baseline SBM stratum and geographic region.
analysis.estimate_desc: Placebo as reference. Odds ratio and 95% confidence interval (CI) for the odds ratio are obtained from the CMH tests controlling for baseline SBM stratum and geographic region.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 12-Week CSBM Frequency Rate
outcome.description: A participant's 12-week CSBM Frequency Rate is the CSBM rate (CSBMs/week) calculated over the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: 72 μg Linaclotide
group.description: 72 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in 12-Week CSBM Frequency Rate
measure.description: A participant's 12-week CSBM Frequency Rate is the CSBM rate (CSBMs/week) calculated over the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on a pairwise comparison versus placebo in an ANCOVA model with treatment group, baseline SBM stratum, and geographic region as factors and baseline value as covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Linaclotide - Placebo. Estimate and 95% CI are based on a least squares (LS) mean difference from an ANCOVA model with treatment group, baseline SBM stratum, and geographic region as factors and baseline value as covariate.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 12-Week SBM Frequency Rate
outcome.description: A participant's 12-week SBM Frequency Rate is the SBM rate (SBMs/week) calculated over the 12-weeks of the Treatment Period. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Stool Consistency Score
outcome.description: Stool consistency was measured daily using the 7-point ordinal Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS; 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts [difficult to pass]; 2 = sausage shaped but lumpy; 3 = like a sausage but with cracks on surface; 4 = like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft; 5 = soft blobs with clear-cut edges [passed easily]; 6 = fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool; 7 = watery, no solid pieces [entirely liquid]). The participant's BSFS score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing BSFS scores from the SBMs reported by the participant during the 12-week Treatment Period.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received ≥ 1 dose of study drug and reported an SBM during the Baseline period. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

outcome.title: Percentage of 12-Week CSBM Overall Responders (>1 SBM/Week Subpopulation)
outcome.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥4 IVRS calls for the specified week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
outcome.population: Participants in the Intent-to-Treat Population who reported >1 SBM/week during the Pretreatment Period (14 days prior to randomization). Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

measure.title: Percentage of Month 3 CSBM Responders
measure.description: A Month 3 CSBM Responder is a participant who is a CSBM weekly responder for at least 3 of the 4 weeks of Month 3 of the Treatment Period. A CSBM weekly responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline based on a minimum of 4 complete IVRS calls for that week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is obtained from the CMH tests controlling for geographic region and baseline stratum.
analysis.estimate_desc: Placebo as reference. Odds ratio and 95% CI for the odds ratio are obtained from the CMH tests controlling for geographic region and baseline stratum.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Abdominal Bloating
outcome.description: Abdominal bloating was measured daily using an 11-point NRS (0 = none; 10 = very severe). The participant's abdominal bloating score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing daily participant assessments of abdominal bloating scores reported during the 12-week Treatment Period.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo, once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: 72 μg Linaclotide
group.description: 72 μg oral linaclotide, once daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Abdominal Bloating
measure.description: Abdominal bloating was measured daily using an 11-point NRS (0 = none; 10 = very severe). The participant's abdominal bloating score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing daily participant assessments of abdominal bloating scores reported during the 12-week Treatment Period.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on a pairwise comparison versus placebo in an ANCOVA model with treatment group, baseline SBM stratum, and geographic region as factors and baseline value as covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Linaclotide - Placebo. Estimate and 95% CI are based on a LS mean difference from an ANCOVA model with treatment group, baseline SBM stratum, and geographic region as factors and baseline value as covariate.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 12-Week Abdominal Discomfort
outcome.description: Abdominal discomfort was measured daily using an 11-point NRS (0 = none; 10 = very severe). The participant's abdominal discomfort score for the Treatment Period is the average of the non-missing daily participant assessments of abdominal discomfort scores reported during the 12-week Treatment Period.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

measure.description: Abdominal discomfort was measured daily using an 11-point NRS (0 = none; 10 = very severe). analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on a pairwise comparison versus placebo in an ANCOVA model with treatment group, baseline SBM stratum, and geographic region as factors and baseline value as covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Linaclotide - Placebo. Estimate and 95% CI are based on a LS mean difference from an ANCOVA model with treatment group, baseline SBM stratum, and geographic region as factors and baseline value as covariate.

outcome.title: Percentage of 12-Week CSBM Overall Sustained Responders
outcome.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Sustained Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period, including ≥ 3 of the last 4 weeks. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥ 4 IVRS calls for the specified week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

measure.title: Percentage of 12-Week CSBM Overall Sustained Responders
measure.description: A 12-week CSBM Overall Sustained Responder is a participant who was a CSBM Weekly Responder for at least 9 of the 12 weeks of the Treatment Period, including ≥ 3 of the last 4 weeks. A CSBM Weekly Responder is a participant who had a CSBM weekly frequency rate that was 3 or greater and increased by 1 or more from baseline, and completed ≥ 4 IVRS calls for the specified week. A CSBM is defined as an SBM that is associated with a sense of complete evacuation. An SBM is defined as a BM that occurred in the absence of laxative, enema, or suppository use on either the calendar day of the BM or the calendar day before the BM.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat Population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Only data for the 72 μg dose versus placebo arms were prospectively defined and evaluated as a secondary endpoint; data for the 145 μg dose arm were defined and evaluated as an additional endpoint per protocol.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is obtained from the CMH tests controlling for baseline SBM stratum and geographic region.
analysis.estimate_desc: Placebo as reference. Odds ratio and 95% CI for the odds ratio are obtained from the CMH tests controlling for baseline SBM stratum and geographic region.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose of double-blind study drug up to Week 12/End of Treatment Visit (Day 85 + 3 days) for nonserious events and within 30 days of the date of last dose of double-blind study drug for serious events.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: PI may publish or disclose the results of the study 24 months after final data lock provided that sponsor can review the publication prior to public release, sponsor can request removal of confidential information of sponsor (not including results of trial), and sponsor can request a publication delay in order to protect potentially patentable information. Furthermore, if a publication committee is developing an initial publication, PI is to delay disclosure until that publication is published.
